page.title: 19The real cost of coal
page.content: Mining today remains a dangerous manual job. Half a century ago, or less,the risk of serious crippling, injury or violent death loomed large in the minds of every miners wife and family. Today, although cushioned against the economics evils of early widowhood, the miners wife slill lives with fear, the threat of imminent redundancy. Our miners are being offered up to Â£35,000 in redundancy payments; Â£1,000 for each year worked up to the age of 50. I spoke to a miners widow, In 1945 her husband was killed in a mining accident. Left with four young children, she recieved Â£750 in compensation. Facts such as these are hidden in the real cost of coal.
